item.description:
8/11/11 Update:  I finally had time to get a good look at the

Tickets.  It is TONIGHT????

I have switched my annual leave from Friday afternoon to

This afternoon so that I have time to get up to Hartford.

I e-mailed Ed via Meet Up.  I will send him a Facebook message

When I get home.

I will print the directions in a few minutes.

It really has been a rotten week so far.  I do plan on

Really enjoying the movie tonight.

Not expecting to "bring a guest" because no one

Else has shown an interest so far.

I will do a review probably tomorrow.

Mike B

8/9/11 Update:  The tickets have come in.  Ed and I can each

Bring a guest.  Is anyone in the Hartford area or in commuting

Distance available to come to see the New "Fright Night" this

Friday, it is a week before it goes to other movie theaters?

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1438176/

www.imdb.com/title/tt1438176/

Update:  I told Danielle & Sarah that I will give them a ticket count by

This Sunday, August 8.  Then they will overnight the tickets to me

so that we will have them before Friday night.  So please

Decide by this Sunday night if you can go or not.  RSVP Counts will

not be added after Sunday night.

Update:  Danielle has informed me that the "Screening" is at

7 p.m. on Friday - August 12.  So I will probably just work a

Half Day so that I can get up to Hartford by around 6 to find

The Theater and parking.

End of update.

The memo is sent to me from Sarah. I told Sarah that we are interested.

I will make it into a Meet Up.

Free movie tickets!!!

I will leave work a half day

To go see the movie.

The time of the "Screening" is not given in the memo.

I will say 8:00 but that can change if they give me a different time.

Yea, Friday is the 12 and Thursday is the 11th.  I am guessing

that it is the right day but wrong date unless told other wise.

The memo is signed Danielle. Here is the memo:

Dear Mike B. , Crystal and Maribeth,

I am reaching out to you on behalf of DreamWorks. We are
promoting our new movie "Fright Night'" which is a remake of
the classic 1980's comedic horror. The new version is starring
Colin Farrell.

Here is a short synopsis of the movie: A remake of the 1985
original, teenager Charley Brewster (Yelchin) guesses that his
new neighbor Jerry Dandrige (Farrell) is a vampire responsible
for a string of recent deaths. When no one he knows believes
him, he enlists Peter Vincent (Tennant), a self proclaimed
vampire killer and Las Vegas magician, to help him take down
Jerry.

We would like to send you some free passes to a screening we
are holding on Friday August 11th at the Bowtie Palace in
Hartford CT to distribute to the members of you meet up group.
Please let me know if you are interested and about how many
passes you would want to receive. I look forward to hearing
from you!

Best,
Danielle

﻿﻿
